greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Indices k such that s_k(5) is a (probable) prime, where s_k(5) = 5*s_{k-1}(5) - s_{k-2}(5), k >= 2, s_0(5) = 1, s_1(5) = 6.
comment: From a problem in A269254. For detailed theory, see [Hone].
link: Andrew N. W. Hone, et al., On a family of sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials, arXiv:1802.01793 [math.NT], 2018.
results.author: _L. Edson Jeffery_, _Bob Selcoe_ and _Andrew Hone_, Feb 02 2018
